story:
You fall into a deep sleep on the sand,
the sound of the waves helping you drift away.
The night is calm and restorative.

You sleep well despite the wind blowing through the night.
In the morning, you feel rested and ready to go.

You sleep poorly because of the mosquitoes,
but still manage to recover a bit of energy.

The rain wakes you several times during the night,
but your body still finds some rest.

You sleep on the hard, uncomfortable ground.
Not ideal, but you regain some strength nonetheless.

You find shelter under a large tree and spend a surprisingly comfortable night.
In the morning, you feel re-energized.

You sleep lightly, alert to every sound around you.
It's not very restful, but better than nothing.

You fall asleep next to your campfire and rest deeply.
The warmth and calm help you recover well.

You end up sleeping most of the day.
You feel much better, though your hunger grows stronger.

You close your eyes and quickly drift off.
You regain your strength, but wake up with an empty stomach.
